Column Comment.0: AREA ID: Unique identifier for any named area
Column Comment.1: AREA TYPE: The type of area described, such as country, province, basin, project,business area etc.
Column Comment.2: DESCRIPTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: A unique number that identifies thedescription for the area. In many cases, these descriptions are codified, but generalremarks about the description may also be added using the REMARK column.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: DESCRIPTION DATE: The date that the description was made for the area.
Column Comment.5: AREA DESCRIPTION CODE: A codified description of an area, such as a projectarea.
Column Comment.6: AREA DESCRIPTION TYPE: The type of description of an area, such as size,terrain, vegetation etc.
Column Comment.7: AVERAGE VALUE: the average value associated with this description.
Column Comment.10: DATE FORMAT DESCRIPTION: Use this column to define the level of precision inthe DATE format colums, such as YYYY, or YYYQQ, or YYYYMM or YYYYMMDD
Column Comment.11: DESCRIPTION: Narrative descriptive comments about the area.
Column Comment.12: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.13: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.14: MAX VALUE: The maximum value associated with this description.
Column Comment.17: DESCRIPTION VALUE: Numeric value associated with the area description.
Column Comment.20: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.21: REMARK: narrative remark about the area description.
Column Comment.22: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.23: SOURCE DOCUMENT: A list of documents that are used as the source for supplyingdata. Source documents may include government and regulatory forms, operatorreports or scout tickets, publications, news letters, books or jounals.
Column Comment.24: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.25: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.26: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.27: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.28: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.29: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.30: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
